title.narrative: Housing Finance Co. of Kenya - Green Financing

description.narrative: The Project is expected to generate a range of social and economic benefits related to mortgage lending. With CCCP funds complimenting IFC''s own funds, it is expected that the Project will also generate environmental benefits through the development of energy efficient green housing projects. The Project may also have a strong demonstration effect in Kenya and beyond - to financial institutions seeking to build their green housing business and to property developers seeking to green their portfolio. Specifically, the Project will: (i) increase access to affordable housing in Kenya through growth in mortgage lending; (ii) help to grow housing supply in Kenya through on-lending to property developers; (iii) facilitate energy efficient housing developments and therefore introduce and promote a new sustainable housing product into the Kenyan market; (iv) enhance environmental and social (E&S) management capacity of HFCK and therefore help the Company to improve E&S and sustainability standards for property developers; and (v) help abate green house gas emissions as a result of construction of green buildings.

The proposed project is a senior loan of up to $16 million for IFCs own account and a senior loan of up to $4 million by IFC in its capacity as the implementing entity of the Canada Climate Change Program (CCCP) to Housing Finance Company of Kenya Limited (HFCK or the Company) to support the Companys funding base and help it grow its mortgage and property development finance business, with an added incentive to develop a green housing portfolio (the Project).
